title: Chilwell
author: Chilwell
content: Things dey happen for Naija wey I no understand, this one wey government wan finish us with inflation, I hope say him don prepare something for abi. Just now now I read it from daily trust wey costumer dey confirm am say him buy one litre of petrol for ₦617.See the link: https://dailytrust.com/breaking-fuel-price-climbs-to-n617-per-litre/Watin go be way forward for us wey no go benefits from minimum wage?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Igebotz on July 18, 2023, 01:10:07 PMFuel subsidy is the reason for PMS price hike so I don't understand why they can't be in the same thread ; if everyone opens a thread when a price goes up or down in different locations what do you think would happen?I don't think I was harsh in my approachFuel was below ₦198 to ₦250 before, after the subsidy was removed, it jumped to ₦530. But according to the recent news:Quote from: https://punchng.com/breaking-marketers-adjust-pumps-as-fuel-price-hits-n617-litreThe pump price of Premium Motor Spirit, popularly called petrol, was raised from N537/litre to N617/litre at some filling stations operated by the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited in Abuja on Tuesday.Quote from: https://punchng.com/breaking-marketers-adjust-pumps-as-fuel-price-hits-n617-litreRecall that President Bola Tinubu had during his inaugural address on May 29, announced that subsidy on petrol had ended, a development that led to the jump in the price of the commodity from N198/litre to over N500/litre on May 30, 2023.Quote from: https://punchng.com/breaking-marketers-adjust-pumps-as-fuel-price-hits-n617-litreSince the withdrawal of subsidy on petrol and the floating of the naira against the dollar, marketers had continued to explain that the cost of PMS could rise to as high as N700/litre.Quote from: https://punchng.com/breaking-marketers-adjust-pumps-as-fuel-price-hits-n617-litreSimilarly, the rise in the cost of crude oil in the international market has also triggered further hike in petrol price, as crude is the product from which PMS and other refined petroleum products are produced from.Or you can read the news in full: https://punchng.com/breaking-marketers-adjust-pumps-as-fuel-price-hits-n617-litreThis is no more about fuel subsidy.

comments.body: Quote from: Chilwell on July 18, 2023, 10:24:48 AMThings dey happen for Naija wey I no understand, this one wey government wan finish us with inflation, I hope say him don prepare something for abi. Just now now I read it from daily trust wey costumer dey confirm am say him buy one litre of petrol for ₦617.See the link: https://dailytrust.com/breaking-fuel-price-climbs-to-n617-per-litre/Watin go be way forward for us wey no go benefits from minimum wage? I was not shocked after seeing this hike in fuel price. After the fuel subsidy removal it was clear that the marketers will be the ones to be regulating the prices of fuel henceforth. The price might go up at anytime and can still go down, so further hike in price shouldn’t still be a surprise to Nigerians. The recent hike in price could be as a cause of the increase in Naira to Dollar rate in the parallel market. Nigerians still take crude oil out of the country to refine and still import back, so since Naira is depreciating against Dollar, the PMS price have to adjust to suit in that price.
